result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald F Breske Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid in 20 days or penalty of 7 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald F Breske Jr

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz in court.   Defendant Gerald F Breske did not appear.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution.  State moves to amend Count #1 to county ordinance disorderly conduct.  Attorney Baltz enters a no contest plea to amended charge.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge and imposes fine of  $367.50 (includes DV surcharge) - to be paid in 20 days, alternate 7 days jail if not paid.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.

Defendant Gerald F Breske in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Baltz is requesting that the case stay on for jury trial. The State is still trying to contact the victim/witness and requests a status on Monday, 11/28/16. Court will reset jury stauts, and leave on for Jury trial.  Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Filed by the State.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
